data.message: How may I remove myself from Facebook?

replies.message: Hey Valerie. If you don't think you'll use Facebook again, you can request to have your account permanently deleted. Please keep in mind that you won't be able to reactivate your account or retrieve anything you've added. Before you do this, you may want to download a copy of your info from Facebook. Then, if you'd like your account permanently deleted with no option for recovery, log into your account and let us know. For more information on permanently deleting your account, please visit our Help center: https://www.facebook.com/help/224562897555674. You also have the option to deactivate your account: https://www.facebook.com/help/214376678584711. Hope this helps! -Hailey

Dear Facebook, I had permanently deleted  my previous facebook account . However, the question is, How do I know if Facebook had deleted all of my data? My friend is still seeing the messages I sent him from my old account, so I'm guessing that my data has not been completely deleted. I really hope that Facebook will answer my question.
Because you deleted your account but someone took it over...there is a flaw in Java that allows stalkers/hackers to retrieve your account. Homeland Security has an alert about it
